active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the potential risks of improper asset transfer (e.g., data leakage during relocation or reuse) and propose mitigation strategies based on NIST SP 800-53 MP-6 and SP 800-88. Consider real-world scenarios like employee offboarding or hardware relocation, and vote on the most critical control.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Asset Security. Topic: Asset Transfer Procedures (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Asset Provisioning > Asset Lifecycle and Maintenance > Asset Ownership and Accountability > Asset Transfer Procedures). Use voter consensus (82.9% approval): Emphasize NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 (MP-6 Media Sanitization, MP-2 Media Access), NIST SP 800-88 Rev. 1 (Clear/Purge/Destroy techniques), full citations, asset lifecycle integration, prerequisites (classification/inventory/ownership). Incorporate pedagogy: - Bloom's objectives: [insert learning_objectives array here] - Scaffolding: [insert scaffolding object here] - Active learning: [insert active_learning object here] Generate 40 high-quality flashcards per the schema: [insert flashcard_schema here] Sources: NIST SP 800-53 Rev. 5 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-53r5), NIST SP 800-88 Rev. 1 (https://doi.org/10.6028/NIST.SP.800-88r1). Ensure completeness, measurable verbs, big-picture risk/compliance context. Output as JSON array of flashcards: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'scaffolding_layer': '...', 'active_learning_link': '...'}}]. Vary difficulty, optimize for Anki/Spaced Repetition.
